title: Metro Bank reportedly begins talks on £1bn flotation
text:

Tue, Sep 8, 2015, 20:29 BST - UK Markets closed Metro Bank reportedly begins talks on £1bn flotation By Michele Maatouk | Sharecast – 3 hours ago 19.5559 0.0000 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Metro Bank has reportedly begun talks with advisers as it steps up its preparations for a London listing with a potential value of more than £1bn. According to Sky News , Metro (Dusseldorf: 62M.DU - news ) - Britain's first new high street lender for more than a century - has asked investment bankers to pitch for roles advising on an initial public offering which could take place as soon as the first quarter of next year. 
The move comes despite the threat of a future hit from Chancellor George Osborne's new corporation tax surcharge, which is expected to rake in more than £25m in annual profits. 
Sky (LSE: BSY.L - news ) cited sources as saying that Metro (Other OTC: MTRAF - news ) aimed to appoint advisers for its planned flotation in the coming weeks. 
Investment banks which have worked on earlier private fundraisings, such as Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Royal Bank of Canada (Other OTC: RBCDF - news ) , are said to be in the frame for key roles on the deal. 
So far, Metro Bank has raised over £600m from investors, meaning the revised total after a successful flotation could reach close to the mooted £1bn valuation of the business. 
Metro Bank has over 35 branches, most of which are in London and the south-east, and has continued to report strong customer and deposit growth despite ongoing losses (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
